meanings.definition: The act of walking or performing other activities while asleep.
meanings.sent1: Somnambulism can be dangerous if the person is not aware of their actions while asleep.
meanings.sent2: She experienced somnambulism and woke up in the kitchen, unsure of how she got there.
meanings.sent3: His somnambulism led him to make a sandwich in his sleep, leaving a mess for his morning self.
meanings.sent4: Her somnambulism was like a silent dance in the night, moving gracefully through the house.
meanings.sent5: The somnambulism of the young boy was a mystery to his family, who tried to understand his nighttime wanderings.

meanings.definition: A condition of engaging in activities that are usually performed during waking hours while asleep.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that somnambulism is more common in children and usually resolves on its own.
meanings.sent2: His somnambulism often involved him talking in his sleep, much to the amusement of his roommates.
meanings.sent3: Her somnambulism caused her to rearrange her room while asleep, creating a surprise for herself in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The somnambulism of the old man was like a journey to a different world every night.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing her somnambulism was like watching a play with no audience, a solo performance in the dark.
